```{r, include = FALSE}
rpn_2016_main2 <- read.csv("rpn_2016_main2.csv")
```

<div style = "margin-bottom:50px;">
```{r}
rpn_2016_main.plob <- 
  as_tibble(rpn_2016_main2) %>%
  mutate_at(vars(location, photo, group), factor) %>%
  filter(group == "plob")
```
</div>

```{r, include = TRUE}
rpn_2016_main.plob
```

First use a two-way ANOVA on the raw data, percent cover given by the proportional value.
Run a two-way ANOVA without interaction becuase there is no replication of .

```{r}
plob.lm1 <- lm(cover ~ location + depth, data = rpn_2016_main.plob)
plob.lm2 <- lm(cover ~ location * depth, data = rpn_2016_main.plob)
```

```{r}
par(mfrow = c(2, 2))
plot(plob.lm1)
```

```{r}
summary(plob.lm1)
```

```{r}
Anova(plob.lm1)
```


```{r}
par(mfrow = c(2, 2))
plot(plob.lm2)
```

```{r}
summary(plob.lm2)
```

```{r}
plob.bm4 <- betareg(plob.scaled ~ bov, data = rpn_2016_main.plob_scaled, 
                    link = c("logit"), link.phi = NULL,
                   type = c("ML"))
```



summary(plob.bm4)
